derivation: a phrase combining G3588 (ὁ ὢν καί ὁ ἦν καί ὁ ἐρχόμενος) with the present participle and imperfect of G1510 (ὁ ὢν καί ὁ ἦν καί ὁ ἐρχόμενος) and the present participle of G2064 (ὁ ὢν καί ὁ ἦν καί ὁ ἐρχόμενος) by means of G2532 (ὁ ὢν καί ὁ ἦν καί ὁ ἐρχόμενος);
kjv_def: which art (is, was), and (which) wast (is, was), and art (is) to come (shalt be)
lemma: ὁ ὢν καί ὁ ἦν καί ὁ ἐρχόμενος
strongs_def: the one being and the one that was and the one coming, i.e. the Eternal, as a divine epithet of Christ
outline: 1. He who is, and was, and is coming
xlit: ho ṑn kaí ho ēn kaí ho erchómenos
pron: ho own kahee ho ane kahee ho er-khom'-en-os
